p: Polygonumins A, a new compound isolated from P. minus, showed promising anticancer and HIV protease inhibition activities. This compound has been filed for a Malaysian patent (PI 2014700594). In summary, our investigation provided promising results supporting the potential use of P. minus in the treatment of cancers such as leukaemia and colorectal and breast cancer and as an anti-HIV agent. Hopefully, these leads can be taken up for the further development of anticancer and anti-HIV drugs.
